articles.author: HT Sports Desk
articles.title: 'Would you like a cup of tea?': Novak Djokovic yells at umpire over crowd noise during Australian Open loss to Sinner - Hindustan Times
articles.description: The incident happened in the fourth set of the Australian Open semifinal match after Sinner gained an early break and lead 3-1 | Tennis News
articles.content: Unlike in his loss against Carlos Alcaraz in the Wimbledon final last year, Novak Djokovic looked more composed, mentally, even as he delivered one of his most flat performances in a Grand Slam match… [+1980 chars]

articles.title: Voting begins in tiny Tuvalu in election that reverberates from China to Australia - NPR
articles.description: The elections come as China, the U.S. and others wrangle for influence in the South Pacific region. Tuvalu is one of 12 countries that have official diplomatic relations with Taiwan.
articles.content:
Funafuti, the main island of the nation state of Tuvalu, is photographed from a Royal New Zealand airforce C130 aircraft as it approaches the tiny South Pacific nation.
Alastair Grant/AP

articles.author: Liz Kruesi
articles.title: The lost continent of Zealandia has been mapped for the first time - National Geographic
articles.description: This enormous chunk of submerged continental crust sits between Antarctica and Australia, where it connected the landmasses as part of a supercontinent some 300 million years ago.
articles.content: After years of exploration and research, scientists have finished mapping a sunken continent that lurks beneath the South Pacific. This chunk of continental crust, driven to the depths millions of ye… [+6660 chars]
